retirementCandidates.name: Memory Before Action
retirementCandidates.description: Always load relevant memory context before taking any significant action
retirementCandidates.approach: Load memory from relevant scopes, filter by tags and context, validate sufficiency before proceeding
examples: Before starting a build wave, load previous wave outcomes
Before deploying, load deployment history and failure patterns
Before architectural changes, load past architecture decisions

retirementCandidates.name: Governance Alignment Check
retirementCandidates.description: Verify all decisions align with governance rules before execution
retirementCandidates.context: Any action that affects project state or architecture
retirementCandidates.approach: Load governance rules from global memory, validate action against rules, flag violations
examples: Check deployment governance before production deploy
Validate architecture change against governance patterns
Ensure QA gates are passed per governance requirements

retirementCandidates.name: Progressive Validation
retirementCandidates.description: Validate in stages: syntax → logic → integration → deployment
retirementCandidates.approach: Execute validation in phases, fail fast on early stages, provide detailed feedback at each stage
examples: Lint before build, build before test, test before deploy
Validate file syntax before applying changes

retirementCandidates.name: Error Context Enrichment
retirementCandidates.description: Enrich errors with memory context to aid in resolution
retirementCandidates.approach: When error occurs, load similar past errors, attach resolution history, provide context-aware suggestions
examples: Build failure → load similar failures → suggest known fixes
Deployment error → check deployment history → identify patterns
QA failure → review past failures in same module → recommend approach

retirementCandidates.name: Confidence-Based Escalation
retirementCandidates.description: Escalate decisions when confidence is low or risks are high
retirementCandidates.approach: Calculate confidence score, escalate to human if below threshold or risk is critical
examples: Low confidence in architecture decision → escalate for review
Critical risk deployment → require human approval

retirementCandidates.name: Incremental Rollout
retirementCandidates.description: Deploy changes incrementally to reduce blast radius
retirementCandidates.approach: Start small, validate, expand gradually, rollback quickly if issues detected
